title: Authors and Citation
text: Sirivongrungson K (2021). zoomclass: Zoom Class. R package version 0.1.0, https://lightbridge-ks.github.io/zoomclass.
code: @Manual{,   title = {zoomclass: Zoom Class},   author = {Kittipos Sirivongrungson},   year = {2021},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://lightbridge-ks.github.io/zoomclass}, }

title: Zoom Class
text: high-level data analysis R package Zoom’s participants report .csv Zoom’s chat .txt file.

title: Zoom Class
text: can install development version GitHub : Functions {zoomclass} package divided 2 categories aims analyse input (mainly) Zoom’s participants report .csv Zoom’s chat .txt file.

title: Zoom Class
text: category, High-level functions design analyse Zoom’s participants report (.csv file), especially checking student’s attendance Zoom classroom.

title: Zoom Class
text: term used “Zoom’s participant report”, basically, CSV log file host can downloaded Zoom meeting ended. contains following columns: Name (Original Name): show participant’s current name Zoom meeting optional original name last balanced parenthesis. User Email: email participant signed Zoom account Join Time: join time participants individual sessions Leave Time: leave time participants individual sessions Duration (Minutes): computed Leave Time - Join Time session Guest: “Yes” means person participants; “” means /host Recording Consent: “Y” means participant allowed recording zoom package comes example data Zoom’s participant report .csv use demo tutorial. can see example files file explorer executing command.
code: # List all example data in `zoomclass` package zoomclass_example() #> [1] "participants_heroes.csv"  # Get a path to specific example data path_heroes <- zoomclass_example("participants_heroes.csv") path_heroes #> [1] "/Users/kittipos/Library/R/x86_64/4.1/library/zoomclass/extdata/participants_heroes.csv" if (interactive() && requireNamespace("fs")) {    fs::file_show(system.file("extdata", package = "zoomclass"))    }

title: Zoom Class
text: read_participants() read data using readr::read_csv() performs followings steps: Read Zoom’s participant report tibble Clean column names, can manipulate easily R Apply appropriate time formatting (POSIXct) relevant columns Extract participant’s current (displayed) name original name Name Name_Original columns, respectively. output tibble zoom_participants subclass. metadata regarding Zoom meeting found, assigned meeting_overview attribute. can see, almost column names cleaned spaces; Join_Time Leave_Time formatted POSIXct object, correctly. Moreover, “015_Loki (Loki Laufeyson)” original Name (Original Name) column extracted “015_Loki” Name “Loki Laufeyson” Name_Original, respectively. output tibble pp_heroes contain sessions information participants. count names participants, can see rows duplicated. example, “Power Girl” 2 rows 2 sessions Zoom (join leave 2 times). Join_Time Leave_Time overlapped 2 sessions? might case ’s joined Zoom 2 devices time. show next, upcoming functions package can detect scenario.
code: pp_heroes <- read_participants(path_heroes)  str(pp_heroes) #> zoom_participants [31 × 9] (S3: zoom_participants/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ Name (Original Name): chr [1:31] "015_Loki (Loki Laufeyson)" "019_Mockingbird" "014_Clea" "003_Power Girl (Kara Zor-L)" ... #>  $ Name                : chr [1:31] "015_Loki" "019_Mockingbird" "014_Clea" "003_Power Girl" ... #>  $ Name_Original       : chr [1:31] "Loki Laufeyson" NA NA "Kara Zor-L" ... #>  $ Email               : chr [1:31] "loki_asgardian@marvel.com" "mockingbird_human@marvel.com" "clea_unknown@marvel.com" "power-girl_kryptonian@dc.com" ... #>  $ Join_Time           : POSIXct[1:31], format: "2021-11-19 09:54:15" "2021-11-19 10:07:44" ... #>  $ Leave_Time          : POSIXct[1:31], format: "2021-11-19 12:01:59" "2021-11-19 12:01:58" ... #>  $ Duration_Minutes    : num [1:31] 128 115 10 114 52 114 113 113 112 112 ... #>  $ Guest               : chr [1:31] "Yes" "Yes" "No" "Yes" ... #>  $ Rec_Consent         : chr [1:31] "Y" "Y" NA "Y" ... library(dplyr) pp_heroes %>%    count(`Name (Original Name)`, sort = TRUE) %>%    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   `Name (Original Name)`          n #>   <chr>                       <int> #> 1 003_Power Girl (Kara Zor-L)     2 #> 2 010_Cyborg Superman             2 #> 3 017_Swarm                       2 #> 4 022_Dazzler                     2 #> 5 001_Magus                       1 #> 6 002_She-Thing                   1 pp_heroes %>%    filter(Name == "003_Power Girl") %>%    select(Name, Email, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Duration_Minutes) #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   Name           Email  Join_Time           Leave_Time          Duration_Minutes #>   <chr>          <chr>  <dttm>              <dttm>                         <dbl> #> 1 003_Power Girl power… 2021-11-19 10:08:26 2021-11-19 12:01:58              114 #> 2 003_Power Girl power… 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58              111

title: Zoom Class
text: Now read Zoom’s participants data , ’s time analyse participants context classroom. now , ’ll call “participant” “student”. Next, 3 class_* functions introduced: class_session() summarizes time information individual sessions students (student multiple sessions, output show ≥ 1 rows per student) class_students() summarizes time information students (1 row per student) class_studentsID() summarizes time information student’s ID extracted student name (1 row per student’s ID) first argument functions receives input zoom_participants tibble created read_participants(). typical academic classroom usually explicit start end time. students arrive class later certain cutoff time point, teacher can mark late. class_* functions, must provide class_start class_end arguments used compute 4 time intervals student spent , , Zoom class: Before_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class started During_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class After_Class: represent time interval student spent Zoom class ended Total_Time: sum time Before_Class + During_Class + After_Class class_students() class_studentsID(), can compute late time period student providing late_cutoff argument. theses time intervals Period object lubridate package. (can converted hours, minutes, secound well.) Furthermore, class_* functions can tell whether students joined Zoom multiple devices time period. use case might live-exam conducted Zoom, want check students joined 1 device (cheating).

title: Zoom Class
text: Suppose Zoom classroom started 10:00 ended 12:00, call class_session() follows: (Input class_start class_end 24-hours clock time PM) previously stated, classroom-related time intervals computed. Let’s see spend time class time , may Loki cast illusion attend Zoom till end :-) Now, let’s see attend Zoom using multiple device time filter Multi_Device = TRUE. Session column displays session number student ranked Join_Time. Let’s see joined Zoom 1 time. can see, “Power Girl” “Swarm” session number = 2; however, aware two joined Zoom one time using 2 devices.
code: pp_heroes_session <-    class_session(pp_heroes,                  class_start = "10:00", # Official class started at 10:00 AM                 class_end = "12:00" # Official class ended at 12:00 PM                 )  pp_heroes_session #> # A tibble: 31 × 17 #>    `Name (Original N… Name    Name_Original Email    Session Class_Start         #>    <chr>              <chr>   <chr>         <chr>      <int> <dttm>              #>  1 001_Magus          001_Ma… <NA>          magus_u…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  2 002_She-Thing      002_Sh… <NA>          she-thi…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  3 003_Power Girl (K… 003_Po… Kara Zor-L    power-g…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  4 003_Power Girl (K… 003_Po… Kara Zor-L    power-g…       2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  5 004_Angel Salvado… 004_An… <NA>          angel-s…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  6 005_Donna Troy     005_Do… <NA>          donna-t…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  7 006_Phoenix        006_Ph… <NA>          phoenix…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  8 007_Birdman        007_Bi… <NA>          birdman…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #>  9 008_Simon Baz      008_Si… <NA>          simon-b…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 10 009_Juggernaut (C… 009_Ju… Cain Marko    juggern…       1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> # … with 21 more rows, and 11 more variables: Class_End <dttm>, #> #   Join_Time <dttm>, Leave_Time <dttm>, Before_Class <Period>, #> #   During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, Total_Time <Period>, #> #   Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Guest <chr>, Rec_Consent <chr>, Multi_Device <lgl> pp_heroes_session %>%    select(Name, ends_with("Class"), Total_Time) %>%    head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   Name                Before_Class During_Class After_Class Total_Time #>   <chr>               <Period>     <Period>     <Period>    <Period>   #> 1 001_Magus           NA           1H 15M 57S   1M 59S      1H 17M 56S #> 2 002_She-Thing       NA           22M 59S      1M 58S      24M 57S    #> 3 003_Power Girl      NA           1H 51M 34S   1M 58S      1H 53M 32S #> 4 003_Power Girl      NA           1H 48M 29S   1M 58S      1H 50M 27S #> 5 004_Angel Salvadore NA           1H 44M 49S   1M 58S      1H 46M 47S #> 6 005_Donna Troy      NA           1H 50M 34S   1M 55S      1H 52M 29S pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(During_Class == lubridate::hours(2)) %>%    select(Name, ends_with("Class")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Name     Before_Class During_Class After_Class #>   <chr>    <Period>     <Period>     <Period>    #> 1 015_Loki 5M 45S       2H 0M 0S     1M 59S pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(Multi_Device  == TRUE) %>%    select(Name, Session, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Multi_Device) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   Name           Session Join_Time           Leave_Time          Multi_Device #>   <chr>            <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              <lgl>        #> 1 003_Power Girl       1 2021-11-19 10:08:26 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 2 003_Power Girl       2 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 3 017_Swarm            1 2021-11-19 10:14:30 2021-11-19 10:24:26 TRUE         #> 4 017_Swarm            2 2021-11-19 10:24:12 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE pp_heroes_session %>%    filter(Session  > 1) %>%    select(Name, Session, Join_Time, Leave_Time, Multi_Device) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   Name              Session Join_Time           Leave_Time          Multi_Device #>   <chr>               <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              <lgl>        #> 1 003_Power Girl          2 2021-11-19 10:11:31 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 2 010_Cyborg Super…       2 2021-11-19 11:28:11 2021-11-19 12:01:58 NA           #> 3 017_Swarm               2 2021-11-19 10:24:12 2021-11-19 12:01:58 TRUE         #> 4 022_Dazzler             2 2021-11-19 11:02:46 2021-11-19 11:29:38 NA

title: Zoom Class
text: class_students() summarizes time information grouped students (grouping variables Name (Original Name) Email). result tibble one row per student. columns output class_session(), except followings: Session_Count: show session counts student (many times student join leave class) First_Join_Time: student multiple sessions, choose earliest join time. Last_Leave_Time: student multiple sessions, choose latest leave time. New optional argument late_cutoff student considered late first joined time later cutoff. late time period shown Late_Time column. Let’s see joined class late > 10 minutes (later 10:25).
code: pp_heroes_students <-    class_students(pp_heroes,                 class_start = "10:00",                class_end = "12:00",                late_cutoff = "10:15" # If student joined later than 10:15 will considered late               )  head(pp_heroes_students) #> # A tibble: 6 × 16 #>   `Name (Original … Name  Name_Original Email  Session_Count Class_Start         #>   <chr>             <chr> <chr>         <chr>          <int> <dttm>              #> 1 001_Magus         001_… <NA>          magus…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 2 002_She-Thing     002_… <NA>          she-t…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 3 003_Power Girl (… 003_… Kara Zor-L    power…             2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 4 004_Angel Salvad… 004_… <NA>          angel…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 5 005_Donna Troy    005_… <NA>          donna…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> 6 006_Phoenix       006_… <NA>          phoen…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 #> # … with 10 more variables: Class_End <dttm>, First_Join_Time <dttm>, #> #   Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, #> #   After_Class <Period>, Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, #> #   Multi_Device <lgl>, Late_Time <Period> pp_heroes_students %>%    filter(Late_Time > lubridate::minutes(10)) %>%    select(Name, First_Join_Time, Late_Time) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   Name               First_Join_Time     Late_Time #>   <chr>              <dttm>              <Period>  #> 1 001_Magus          2021-11-19 10:44:03 29M 3S    #> 2 002_She-Thing      2021-11-19 11:37:01 1H 22M 1S #> 3 012_Shang-Chi      2021-11-19 11:18:16 1H 3M 16S #> 4 021_Winter Soldier 2021-11-19 11:00:49 45M 49S   #> 5 022_Dazzler        2021-11-19 11:01:02 46M 2S

title: Zoom Class
text: Supposed ’ve checked class attendance student, perhaps want merge data database key columns usually student’s ID. First, informed students put student’s ID names, example: “001_Megus”. class_studentsID() help summarizes time information grouped student’s ID. , can used IDs merge database. internal processes class_studentsID() extracts student’s ID Name (Original Name) column using regular expression provided id_regex. , time information summarized per student’s ID (grouping variable ID), rest output columns similar class_students(). Finally, result tibble one row per ID. (ID founded multiple names (e.g. “001_Magus”, “001_magus”), Name column contain combinations names particular ID.)
code: pp_heroes_studentsID <-    class_studentsID(pp_heroes,                     id_regex = "\\d+", # Extract digits from student name as student's ID                    class_start = "10:00",                    class_end = "12:00",                    late_cutoff = "10:15" # If student joined later than 10:15 will considered late                    )  head(pp_heroes_studentsID) #> # A tibble: 6 × 15 #>   ID    Name      Email    Session_Count Class_Start         Class_End           #>   <chr> <chr>     <chr>            <int> <dttm>              <dttm>              #> 1 001   001_Magus magus_u…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 2 002   002_She-… she-thi…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 3 003   003_Powe… power-g…             2 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 4 004   004_Ange… angel-s…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 5 005   005_Donn… donna-t…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> 6 006   006_Phoe… phoenix…             1 2021-11-19 10:00:00 2021-11-19 12:00:00 #> # … with 9 more variables: First_Join_Time <dttm>, Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, #> #   Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, #> #   Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Multi_Device <lgl>, #> #   Late_Time <Period>

title: Zoom Class
text: , give example merging student data database. package provides heroes_students data frame contain names ID student enrolled course semester. can join heroes_students pp_heroes_studentsID using dplyr::*_join functions ID.
code: head(heroes_students) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   ID    Name            Enrolled #>   <chr> <chr>           <lgl>    #> 1 001   Magus           FALSE    #> 2 002   She-Thing       TRUE     #> 3 003   Power Girl      FALSE    #> 4 004   Angel Salvadore TRUE     #> 5 005   Donna Troy      FALSE    #> 6 006   Phoenix         TRUE heroes_students %>%    filter(Enrolled) %>%    # Merge to Zoom data by `ID`   full_join(pp_heroes_studentsID, by = "ID", suffix = c("_from_ID", "_from_Zoom")) #> # A tibble: 27 × 17 #>    ID    Name_from_ID    Enrolled Name_from_Zoom     Email         Session_Count #>    <chr> <chr>           <lgl>    <chr>              <chr>                 <int> #>  1 002   She-Thing       TRUE     002_She-Thing      she-thing_ra…             1 #>  2 004   Angel Salvadore TRUE     004_Angel Salvado… angel-salvad…             1 #>  3 006   Phoenix         TRUE     006_Phoenix        phoenix_muta…             1 #>  4 007   Birdman         TRUE     007_Birdman        birdman_eter…             1 #>  5 008   Simon Baz       TRUE     008_Simon Baz      simon-baz_hu…             1 #>  6 010   Cyborg Superman TRUE     010_Cyborg Superm… cyborg-super…             2 #>  7 012   Shang-Chi       TRUE     012_Shang-Chi (Xu… shang-chi_hu…             1 #>  8 014   Clea            TRUE     014_Clea           clea_unknown…             1 #>  9 015   Loki            TRUE     015_Loki (Loki La… loki_asgardi…             1 #> 10 017   Swarm           TRUE     017_Swarm          swarm_mutant…             2 #> # … with 17 more rows, and 11 more variables: Class_Start <dttm>, #> #   Class_End <dttm>, First_Join_Time <dttm>, Last_Leave_Time <dttm>, #> #   Before_Class <Period>, During_Class <Period>, After_Class <Period>, #> #   Total_Time <Period>, Duration_Minutes <dbl>, Multi_Device <lgl>, #> #   Late_Time <Period>

title: Zoom Class
text: final functions package design parse program Zoom chat file .txt file tibble, just execute followings:

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: class_session() designed retrieve time information student's session Zoom's classroom given time period. Input function (data) zoom_participants object returned read_participants().

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
code: class_session(   data,   class_start = NULL,   class_end = NULL,   arrange_by = c("Join_Time", "Name", "None"),   arrange_group = c("Name-Email", "Session", "None"),   period_to = c("period", "second", "minute", "hour"),   round_digits = NULL )

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: data data frame (tibble) class zoom_participants class_start (Character) time class started, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "Start_Time" attribute used. class_end (Character) time class ended, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "End_Time" attribute used. arrange_by (Character) arrange rows, must one : "Join_Time": arrange Join_Time, earliest first "Name": arrange Name (Original Name) "None": arrange, preserve rows original Zoom's participant file arrange_group (Character) Indicate group arrange_by affected. "Name-Email": group Name (Original Name) Email "Session": group Session "None": grouping variable period_to (Character) Indicate units "Before_Class", "During_Class", "After_Class" "Total_Time" output. Must one : "period" (default): return lubridate::period object "second": return seconds (numeric) "minute": return minute (numeric) "hour": return hour (numeric) round_digits (Integer) significant digits round numeric columns. NULL (default), round.

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: data frame (tibble) class zoom_class. following columns: "Name (Original Name)": column "Name (Original Name)" input file "Name": Current name displayed Zoom meeting participants. "Name_Original": Original name participants. extracted contents within last balanced parentheses "Name (Original Name)". "Email": original "User Email" column "Session": Indicate active session(s) Zoom students. Computed ranking "Join_Time" grouping variables: "Name (Original Name)" "Email". "Class_Start" (POSIXct): Compute date "Join_Time" time specified class_start argument. "Class_End" (POSIXct): Compute date "Leave_Time" time specified class_end argument. "Join_Time": original "Join Time" column "Leave_Time": original "Leave Time" column "Before_Class": Time spent class_start session. "During_Class": Time spent class (class_start class_end) session. "After_Class": Time spent class_end session. "Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": original "Duration (Minutes)" column "Rec_Consent": original "Recording Consent" column "Multi_Device": TRUE sessions student joined Zoom multiple devices. computed checking whether "Join_Time" "Leave_Time" overlapped sessions within students. Otherwise, NA returned way certain students joined single device.

title: Zoom Class Session Summary — class_session
text: providing time class started (class_start) ended (class_end), function compute time spent , , class sessions. student joined classroom using multiple device, TRUE placed "Multi_Device" column output. output displayed one row per session student. (e.g., student "" joined one time, multiple rows ""). Finally, rows arranged specified arrange_by grouping arrange_group.

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: class_students() designed retrieve time information students Zoom's classroom given time period. Input function (data) zoom_participants object returned read_participants().

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
code: class_students(   data,   class_start = NULL,   class_end = NULL,   late_cutoff = NULL,   period_to = c("period", "second", "minute", "hour"),   round_digits = NULL )

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: data data frame (tibble) class zoom_participants class_start (Character) time class started, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "Start_Time" attribute used. class_end (Character) time class ended, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "End_Time" attribute used. late_cutoff (Character) Late time cutoff (input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm"). provided, "Late_Time" included output columns. period_to (Character) Indicate units "Before_Class", "During_Class", "After_Class" "Total_Time" output. Must one : "period" (default): return lubridate::period object "second": return seconds (numeric) "minute": return minute (numeric) "hour": return hour (numeric) round_digits (Integer) significant digits round numeric columns. NULL (default), round.

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: data frame (tibble) class zoom_class. following columns: "Name (Original Name)": column "Name (Original Name)" input file "Name": Current name displayed Zoom meeting participants. "Name_Original": Original name participants. extracted contents within last balanced parentheses "Name (Original Name)". "Email": original "User Email" column "Session_Count": Show counts many session students joined leaved Zoom class. "Class_Start" (POSIXct): Compute date "Join_Time" time specified class_start argument. "Class_End" (POSIXct): Compute date "Leave_Time" time specified class_end argument. "First_Join_Time": First join time students "Last_Leave_Time": Last leave time students "Before_Class": Time spent class_start student. "During_Class": Time spent class (class_start class_end) student. "After_Class": Time spent class_end student. "Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": Sum "Duration (Minutes)" students. Notice: Total_Time likely less original Duration_Minutes latter round decimal . difference pronounced summed multiple sessions. "Multi_Device": TRUE students joined Zoom multiple devices session. "Late_Time" (Optional): provide late_cutoff "hh:mm:ss", "Late_Time" period computed Join_Time - late_cutoff.

title: Zoom Class Students Summary — class_students
text: providing time class started (class_start) ended (class_end), function compute time spent , , class students. Furthermore, Late time period can calculated students joined Zoom class later certain cutoff time (late_cutoff). students joined classroom using multiple device sessions, TRUE placed "Multi_Device" column output. result displayed one row per student. "Session_Count" counts many times students join leave Zoom class.

what: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
text: Similar class_students(), class_studentsID() designed retrieve time information students Zoom's classroom given time period. Input function (data) zoom_participants object returned read_participants().

title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
code: class_studentsID(   data,   id_regex = ".*",   collapse = "; ",   class_start = NULL,   class_end = NULL,   late_cutoff = NULL,   period_to = c("period", "second", "minute", "hour"),   round_digits = NULL )

title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
text: data data frame (tibble) class zoom_participants id_regex (Character) regular expression used extract student's ID Name (Original Name) ID column collapse (Character) collapse "Name (Original Name)" "Email" found multiple different names Email student's ID. class_start (Character) time class started, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "Start_Time" attribute used. class_end (Character) time class ended, input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm". NULL (default) zoom_participants meeting_overview attribute, "End_Time" attribute used. late_cutoff (Character) Late time cutoff (input "hh:mm:ss" "hh:mm"). provided, "Late_Time" included output columns. period_to (Character) Indicate units "Before_Class", "During_Class", "After_Class" "Total_Time" output. Must one : "period" (default): return lubridate::period object "second": return seconds (numeric) "minute": return minute (numeric) "hour": return hour (numeric) round_digits (Integer) significant digits round numeric columns. NULL (default), round.

title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
text: data frame (tibble) class zoom_class. following columns: "ID": student's ID extracted Name (Original Name) id_regex. Unmatched ID leave NA bottom rows. "Name": Name combinations Name (Original Name) IDs "Email": Email combinations Email IDs "Session_Count": Show counts many session students joined leaved Zoom class. "Class_Start" (POSIXct): Compute date "Join_Time" time specified class_start argument. "Class_End" (POSIXct): Compute date "Leave_Time" time specified class_end argument. "First_Join_Time": First join time student's ID "Last_Leave_Time": Last leave time student's ID "Before_Class": Time spent class_start student's ID. "During_Class": Time spent class (class_start class_end) student's ID. "After_Class": Time spent class_end student's ID. "Total_Time": "Before_Class" + "During_Class" + "After_Class" "Duration_Minutes": Sum "Duration (Minutes)" students. Notice: Total_Time likely less original Duration_Minutes latter round decimal . difference pronounced summed multiple sessions. "Multi_Device": TRUE students joined Zoom multiple devices session. "Late_Time" (Optional): provide late_cutoff "hh:mm:ss", "Late_Time" period computed Join_Time - late_cutoff.

title: Zoom Class Students ID Summary — class_studentsID
